metadata.Title: CVE-2021-29991 on Ubuntu 20.04 FIPS Compliant (focal) - medium.
metadata.Description:
Firefox incorrectly accepted a newline in a HTTP/3 header, interpretting it as two separate headers. This allowed for a header splitting attack against servers using HTTP/3. This vulnerability affects Firefox < 91.0.1 and Thunderbird < 91.0.1.

Update Instructions:

Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2021-29991` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
by updating your system to the following package versions:

firefox - 91.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-geckodriver - 91.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
firefox-mozsymbols - 91.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

thunderbird - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-gnome-support - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
thunderbird-mozsymbols - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-calendar-timezones - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-gdata-provider - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
xul-ext-lightning - 1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1
No subscription required

notes.Note: tyhicks> mozjs contains a copy of the SpiderMonkey JavaScript engine

criterions.comment: firefox package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '91.0.1+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
mozjs52 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
mozjs68 package in focal is affected and may need fixing.
thunderbird package in focal was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '1:91.5.0+build1-0ubuntu0.20.04.1').
